Going to try and reduce the dosage and see what happens.

column1: Urine Leakage When there is a Strong Desire to Void
column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After having prostate cancer the prostate was removed along with lymth nodes. I had major problems with incontintency but after taking the drug for five weeks the improvement has been staggering. I had the op three months ago and was getting very depressed with the incontinentency. Being a 65 year old male I found the issues very depressing and at times I wished I hadnt had the op but now after taking the drug I am enjoying life once again. Hopefully I will stop wearing the pads in the next couple of weeks.

column2: Debbie V, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Caregiver)
column9: My 84 year old mother, who has dementia, had been taking 4mg per day for many years. Initially it helped a lot, but her incontinence has progressively worsened. The urologist had her try 2 other meds, and she was off of all incontinence meds for a full week before starting the next med. She was MUCH less confused and had fewer memory issues while off the meds. She has also had many more dental cavities lately, and I have read it can be related to the dry mouth that Detrol causes. We have decided to take her off the incontinence meds permanently.

column2: sunatrya, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: my main symptom was just suddenly needing to pee so badly that I couldn't hold it, usually hitting just as I walked in the front door or as I was trying to drop my pants.  Detrol reduced that symptom, but it made me have to pee more often instead.  It also made me incredibly thirsty (not dry mouth, plenty of spit!), gave me dry eyes and a horrible sore throat...it felt like swallowing broken glass!  I was about to stop taking it when I accidently found out that the sore throat was less severe if I took an allergy med at the same time (Zyrtec)  I MIGHT be albe to tolerate the side effects if I take the Zyrtec too, otherwise they're too bad for me to cope.  This makes me wonder, though, if the throat is an actual allergic reason instead of a side effect.  I'm going to see if the doctor will give me something else.

column2: bkatt13, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been on Detrol LA, and any of the other medications that treat Overactive Bladder for over the past 10 years.  I have experieced all of the side effects that they list.  I am tired all the time, and have blurry vision.  I also have the dry eyes, dry mouth and the constipation that are shown to be side effects.  But what we are not told is that if this medication has such a drying  effect on the eyes, mouth and bowels...what about the rest of our body???  The skin over my entire body is dry, and this medication has destroyed my scalp.  I am clawing at it all the time.  I have tried different shampoos as reccommended by a dermotologist and no relief.  Detrol LA is not smart enough to only dry the areas we are told about by the pharmisudical company that manufactures it.  It is drying the entire body.  I also suffer from urge incontinence, so I am always struggling with these issues...but I am going to visit a gyn urologist and see if I have any other options.  Living with these side effects is not an optimal way to live if there are other options.  I hope I can get off of this.  I also saw people posting memory issues...I just thought mine were hormonal.  Maybe not, I just don't know.

column1: Urine Leakage When there is a Strong Desire to Void
column2: ppattibpatt, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Detrol LA for over 5 yrs and I recommend this drug.  I have learned to deal with the side effects by sipping water during the day instead of waiting until I'm thirsty, and urinating ever 2 hours or so when I'm able.  This greatly reduces accidents and painful urges as well as my fear of going out.  I am able to hold it all night, although my bladder is painfully full in the morning!  I cannot hold urine that long during the day, once I have the urge I can usually only hold it for another 20 minutes.I have occasional constipation but only when I don't sip water all day long.  Dizzy spells are about 5 seconds or less, almost like a 'shift' and have decreased over time.  I didn't know about the adverse affects to memory when I started taking this drug, so it explains why I've been worrying that I was developing Alzheimer's at age 45!  It is awful!  This is something I'll discuss with my doctor the next time I see her.  In the meantime, I'll keep writing lists to help me remember.  Overall, this was an amazing product from the start and I am able to miss a pill on occasion should I forget to take it or something comes up.  I am going to try to take this pill every other day to see if I can reduce the side effects as I see some people don't take it everyday and still feel it's effective for them.  I haven't tried any other medication and wouldn't change it at this point.

column2: Elizabeth, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took Detrol LA for three weeks in January of 2007. I didn't have dry mouth, or dry lips and nose. I developed severe constipation constipation which developed into chronic constipation. I have been suffering after taking Detrol LA for more than a year now. I never had constipation before taking Detrol LA. I took this medication for three weeks and discontinued it more than a year ago and am suffering every day since with Chronic Constipation. I have used several laxatives like Dulcolax, Senna Smooth, Ex Lax Chocolate Chews, and Correctol to name a few to combat my constipation. Including Miralax and Enulose. I am currently taking Amitiza for Chronic Constipation. I will never be the same again after taking Detrol LA. I do not recommend this medication to any one. I do not wish anyone to go through the horror that I have and am still going through.
